issue.title: [Dev] In-progress  jira issue is not resolved by pr merging tool
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-13911](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13911). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
PR merging tool applies "Resolve Issue" action to the jira issue when PR is merged.[1]
"Resolve Issue" can only be applied to open issues, not an issue in-progress.
In the web UI, there's no "Resolve Issue" button for a jira in progress.
So if you clicked "Start Progress" button of an open issue, that issue will not be resolved by the PR merging script. This looks to me a bug of Jira.

[1] https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/dev/merge_arrow_pr.py#L202-L203

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13911?focusedCommentId=17410301) by Yibo Cai (yibocai):*
Maybe it's related to Jira version.
In Jira system I use inside company, an "In-Progress" Jira can be "Resolved".

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13911?focusedCommentId=17410365) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
FYI: I can see the "Resolve Issue" button in "IN PROGRESS" issue:

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13911?focusedCommentId=17410369) by Yibo Cai (yibocai):*
Strange. "Resolve Issue" is available also for this issue.
I met with this issue in dealing with ARROW-13067.
Anyway, it's not important. Possibly some spurious error.
